cheatsheet.title: Configure and Use the R Package Builder

intro.description: This cheat sheet shows how to configure an universal launch configuration to build an R package from within Eclipse.

item.title: Open Configuration Dialog
item.description:
Go to Run > External Tools > Open External Tools Dialog... and select R CMD Tools.
Create a new launch configuration by double-clicking on the selected node or by clicking on the New launch configuration icon.
Fill in a Name for this launch configuration.

item.title: 1) Main Tab
item.description:
Choose Add-on Packages: Build from the drop-down menu of commands.
If you want to use this configuration to build binary packages, you can add --binary as an option in the Options/Arguments text field. To see other options that might be specified, click on the Run '--help' button.

item.title: 2) R Config Tab
item.description:
Choose an R Environment you previously configured to be used as R package builder.
This can either be the R Environment that was set as default for use in the workbench (Workbench Default) or an other R Environment of your choice (Selected Configuration).
If you would like to configure a new R environment for the R package builder, you can do so by pushing the Configure... button.

item.title: 3) Common Tab
item.description: If you would like the R package builder to be listed in the External Tools favorites menu on the workbench toolbar, you can check the External Tools box in the Display in favorites menu.

item.title: Use an R Package Builder
item.description:
In order to use an R package builder you configured, you need to first select the package root folder in the Project Explorer view, because the target was configured as '${resource_loc}' (variable for location of currently selected resource in the active view).
If you configured an R package builder, you can make use of it via Run > External Tools or via the External Tools button on the workbench toolbar. If during configuration you specified to display the R package builder within the favorites, it will be visible directly under the External Tools. To run the given R package builder, click on its name.
If you did not add it to the favorites during configuration, you need to select Open External Tools Dialog... and click on the configuration you would like to run. Next, click on the Run button to launch the R package builder on your package folder and create your package.
